faculties_accepted: Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (FASS)
College of Design and Engineering (CDE or FoE)
Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine (YLLSOM)
Yong Siew Toh Conservatory of Music (YSTCM)
module_restrictions: Ensure that you meet the pre-requisites for the courses you are applying for.
visa_info: Once your exchange application has been approved by Chulalongkorn University, you will receive an acceptance letter, along with a letter for visa application. International students require a Non-Immigrant Education Visa (category ED) to study in Thailand. Applications should be made at the Royal Thai Embassy before departure to Thailand.
accommodations_info: Chulalongkorn University International House (CU iHouse) is a 26-storey, 846-unit, on-campus residence for international students and lecturers. Rooms come fully furnished with air conditioner, modern conveniences, 24-hour security and safety systems. Kindly note that CU iHouse has limited availability. Please apply as early as possible or explore other alternative accommodation options. Off-campus accommodations recommended by CU are Nonsi-residence [http://www.nonsiresidence.com/] and I-sanook [https://www.i-sanook.com/en-us].
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses breakdown includes:

- Accommodation: THB14,000 – THB22,000
- Food: THB5,000 – THB12,000
- Transport: THB1,000 – THB3,000
- Others (Entertainment, clothes): THB5,000 – THB8,000

The monthly estimate for cost of living is THB25,000 – THB45,000.
